description:
## Id
AWSResilienceHub-SimulateS3ObjectsAccidentalDeleteTest_2020-04-01

## Intent
Test the case where all versions of files in a subfolder in the bucket were deleted and restored from a backup bucket

## Type
TEST

## Risk
High

## Requirements
  * S3 bucket on which the mock subfolder to be cleaned, will be created on
  * Objects in the test subfolder on that bucket are constantly requested during test
  * Alarm for metric [4xxErrors](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/metrics-dimensions.html) setup for the S3 bucket
  * S3 bucket that will be used to backup the subfolder after deletion

## Permissions required for AutomationAssumeRole
  * s3:DeleteObject
  * s3:GetObject
  * s3:DeleteObjectVersion
  * s3:ListBucket
  * s3:ListBucketVersions
  * s3:ListObjectsV2
  * s3:ListObjectVersions
  * s3:PutObject
  * ssm:StartAutomationExecution
  * ssm:GetAutomationExecution
  * sns:Publish
  * ssm:GetParameters
  * cloudwatch:DescribeAlarms
  * iam:PassRole

##### Permissions required in case KMS encryption is used
  * kms:GenerateDataKey
  * kms:Decrypt
  * kms:Encrypt

## Supports Rollback
No. No rollback behavior is needed as injected failure affects mock data which exists only for the test. "onCancel" and "onFailure" will skip to a step which will delete said subfolder if it exists.

## Cancellation behavior
Delete test subfolder if it exists.

## Inputs
### (Required) AutomationAssumeRole
  * type: String
  * description: ARN of the IAM role with permissions listed above

### (Required) S3BucketWhereObjectsWillBeDeletedFrom
  * type: String
  * description: The S3 Bucket Name where objects will be deleted

### (Required) S3BucketToRestoreWhereObjectWillBeCopiedTo
  * type: String
  * description: The S3 Bucket Name where objects will be copied

### (Required) S3UserErrorAlarmName
  * type: String
  * description: Alarm for metric [4xxErrors](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/metrics-dimensions.html) setup for the S3 bucket

### (Required) SNSTopicARNForManualApproval
  * type: String
  * description: The ARN of the SNS Topic where a user will receive the notification about the manual approval of the creation of the test subfolder.

### (Required) SNSTopicIAMPrincipalForManualApproval
  * type: String
  * description:
    ARN of AWS authenticated principal which is able to either approve or reject the creation of the test subfolder. Can be either an AWS Identity and Access
    Management (IAM) user name or IAM user ARN or IAM role ARN or IAM assume role user ARN

## Details
The document creates a subfolder in the format of "arh-4xxErrors-test-timestamp" with 10 objects inside. It injects failure by clearing the objects from that subfolder. Those objects should be constantly
requested to trigger the alarm for metric `4xxErrors`.

## Steps executed in normal flow
  * GenerateSubfolderNameBeforeCreation
  * CheckNoSubfolderOnBothBuckets
  * AssertNoSubfolderOnBothBuckets
  * ApproveSubfolderCreation
  * CreateSubfolderWithTestFiles
  * AssertAlarmToBeGreenBeforeTest
  * BackupCurrentExecution
  * InjectFailure
  * AssertAlarmToBeRed
  * RollbackCurrentExecution
  * AssertAlarmToBeGreen
  * DeleteSubfolderAfterTest

## Outputs
None

S3BucketWhereObjectsWillBeDeletedFrom.description: (Required) The S3 Bucket Name where objects will be deleted.

S3BucketToRestoreWhereObjectWillBeCopied.description: (Required) The S3 Bucket Name where objects will be copied.

AutomationAssumeRole.description: (Required) The ARN of the role that allows Automation to perform the actions on your behalf.

S3UserErrorAlarmName.description: (Required) Alarm for metric `4xxErrors` setup for the S3 bucket

SNSTopicARNForManualApproval.description: (Required) The ARN of the SNS Topic where a user will receive the notification about the manual approval of the creation of the test subfolder.

IAMPrincipalForManualApproval.description: (Required) ARN of AWS authenticated principal which is able to either approve or reject the creation of the test subfolder. Can be either an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user name or IAM user ARN or IAM role ARN or IAM assume role user ARN

mainSteps.name: GenerateSubfolderNameBeforeCreation
mainSteps.description: Get the name of the test subfolder in the format of 'prefix-timestamp'.

inputs.Script:
from datetime import datetime, timezone
import math
import boto3
from botocore.config import Config
import time
import dateutil.parser



def generate_test_subfolder_name_before_creation(events, context):
    if ('SubfolderPrefix' not in events):
        raise KeyError('Requires SubfolderPrefix in events')

    subfolder = f"{events['SubfolderPrefix']}-{math.floor(time.time())}"

    return {'Subfolder': subfolder}

mainSteps.name: CheckNoSubfolderOnBothBuckets
mainSteps.description: Check if there is no subfolder in the format of 'arh-4xxErrors-test-timestamp' on both source and target buckets.

inputs.Script:
from datetime import datetime, timezone
import math
import boto3
from botocore.config import Config
import time
import dateutil.parser



def check_no_subfolder_on_both_buckets(events, context):
    if ('SourceBucket' not in events or 'TargetBucket' not in events
            or 'Subfolder' not in events):
        raise KeyError('Requires SourceBucket, TargetBucket and Subfolder in events')

    source_bucket = events['SourceBucket']
    target_bucket = events['TargetBucket']
    subfolder = events['Subfolder']

    does_subfolder_exist_on_source = folder_exists_and_not_empty(source_bucket, subfolder)
    does_subfolder_exist_on_target = folder_exists_and_not_empty(target_bucket, subfolder)

    return {'NoSubfolderOnBothBuckets': not does_subfolder_exist_on_source and not does_subfolder_exist_on_target}

def folder_exists_and_not_empty(bucket: str, path: str) -> bool:
    '''
    Folder should exists.
    Folder should not be empty.
    '''
    s3 = boto3.client('s3')
    if not path.endswith('/'):
        path = path + '/'
    resp = s3.list_objects_v2(Bucket=bucket, Prefix=path, Delimiter='/', MaxKeys=1)
    return 'Contents' in resp

mainSteps.name: AssertNoSubfolderOnBothBuckets
mainSteps.description: End the execution if the subfolder exists on one of the buckets.

mainSteps.name: ApproveSubfolderCreation
mainSteps.description: Request an approval from the user to create the dedicated subfolder for the test.

inputs.Message: A dedicated subfolder on the {{S3BucketWhereObjectsWillBeDeletedFrom}} will be created for the S3 accidental_delete test, which will be deleted at the end of the test. Do you approve?

mainSteps.name: CreateSubfolderWithTestFiles
mainSteps.description: Create a dedicated subfolder with test files.

inputs.Script:
from datetime import datetime, timezone
import math
import boto3
from botocore.config import Config
import time
import dateutil.parser




def create_test_subfolder_with_test_objects(events, context):
    s3_client = boto3.client('s3')

    if ('NumberOfObjectsToPut' not in events or 'S3BucketName' not in events
            or 'Subfolder' not in events):
        raise KeyError('Requires NumberOfObjectsToPut, S3BucketName and Subfolder in events')

    bucket_name = events['S3BucketName']
    number_of_objects_to_put = events['NumberOfObjectsToPut']
    subfolder = events['Subfolder']

    for i in range(int(number_of_objects_to_put)):
        s3_client.put_object(Bucket=bucket_name, Key=f'{subfolder}/{i}.txt',
                             Body=bytes(f'Content of the {i} file', encoding='utf-8'))

    return {'Subfolder': subfolder}

mainSteps.name: AssertAlarmToBeGreenBeforeTest
mainSteps.description: Ensure alarm is green before starting test. Fail if alarm is not green within expected time.

mainSteps.name: BackupCurrentExecution
mainSteps.description: Copy the files from the subfolder on the source bucket to the subfolder on the backup bucket.

inputs.Script:
from datetime import datetime, timezone
import math
import boto3
from botocore.config import Config
import time
import dateutil.parser




def copy_to_subfolder(events, context):
    if ('SourceBucket' not in events or 'TargetBucket' not in events
            or 'Subfolder' not in events):
        raise KeyError('Requires SourceBucket, TargetBucketName and Subfolder in events')

    source_bucket = events["SourceBucket"]
    target_bucket = events["TargetBucket"]
    subfolder = events["Subfolder"]

    if not subfolder.endswith('/'):
        subfolder = subfolder + '/'

    copied_count = copy_from_bucket_to_bucket(source_bucket, target_bucket, subfolder)

    return {'CopiedFilesNumber': copied_count}



def copy_from_bucket_to_bucket(source_bucket, target_bucket, prefix=None):
    config = Config(retries={'max_attempts': 20, 'mode': 'standard'})
    s3_client = boto3.client('s3', config=config)
    paginator = s3_client.get_paginator('list_objects_v2')
    if prefix:
        pages = paginator.paginate(Bucket=source_bucket, Prefix=prefix)
        print(f'Starting to copy files under prefix {prefix} from the {source_bucket} bucket '
              f'to the {target_bucket} bucket...')
    else:
        pages = paginator.paginate(Bucket=source_bucket)
        print(f'Starting to copy files from the {source_bucket} bucket '
              f'to the {target_bucket} bucket...')

    copied_count = 0
    for page in pages:
        print(f'The response from the list_objects_v2: {page}')
        if 'Contents' in page:
            for content in page["Contents"]:
                print(f'Copying the file {content["Key"]}...')

                copy_source = {
                    'Bucket': source_bucket,
                    'Key': content["Key"]
                }
                s3_client.copy(copy_source, target_bucket, content["Key"])

                print(f'The file {content["Key"]} was successfully copied')

                copied_count += 1

    print(f'The file number of copied files is {copied_count}')

    return copied_count

mainSteps.name: InjectFailure
mainSteps.description: If the dedicated subfolder exists on the source bucket, clean it.

inputs.Script:
from datetime import datetime, timezone
import math
import boto3
from botocore.config import Config
import time
import dateutil.parser




def clean_subfolder_if_exists(events, context):
    if 'Bucket' not in events or 'Subfolder' not in events:
        raise KeyError('Requires Bucket, Subfolder in events')

    bucket = events["Bucket"]
    subfolder = events["Subfolder"]

    does_subfolder_exist_on_target = folder_exists_and_not_empty(bucket, subfolder)
    number_of_deleted_objects = 0

    if does_subfolder_exist_on_target:
        clean_bucket_output = clean_bucket({
            "S3BucketNameToClean": bucket,
            "Prefix": subfolder
        }, None)
        number_of_deleted_objects = clean_bucket_output['NumberOfDeletedObjects']

    return {'NumberOfDeletedObjects': number_of_deleted_objects}



def folder_exists_and_not_empty(bucket: str, path: str) -> bool:
    '''
    Folder should exists.
    Folder should not be empty.
    '''
    s3 = boto3.client('s3')
    if not path.endswith('/'):
        path = path + '/'
    resp = s3.list_objects_v2(Bucket=bucket, Prefix=path, Delimiter='/', MaxKeys=1)
    return 'Contents' in resp



def clean_bucket(events, context):
    """
    Clean bucket by removing versioned objects and delete markers
    :return: Number of removed versioned objects and delete markers
    """
    if 'S3BucketNameToClean' not in events:
        raise KeyError('Requires S3BucketNameToClean in events')

    s3_bucket_name_to_clean = events['S3BucketNameToClean']
    prefix = events.get('Prefix') or None

    config = Config(retries={'max_attempts': 20, 'mode': 'standard'})
    s3_client = boto3.client('s3', config=config)
    paginator = s3_client.get_paginator('list_object_versions')

    if prefix:
        pages = paginator.paginate(Bucket=s3_bucket_name_to_clean, Prefix=prefix)
        print(f'Sending the list_object_versions request for all objects under the {prefix} prefix,'
              f' of the {s3_bucket_name_to_clean} bucket...')
    else:
        pages = paginator.paginate(Bucket=s3_bucket_name_to_clean)
        print(f'Sending the list_object_versions request for all objects of the {s3_bucket_name_to_clean} bucket...')

    number_of_deleted_objects = 0

    for page in pages:
        print(f'The response from the list_object_versions: {page}')

        versions: list = page.get('Versions')
        if versions is not None:
            for version in versions:
                key = version.get('Key')
                version_id = version.get('VersionId')
                s3_client.delete_object(Bucket=s3_bucket_name_to_clean, Key=key, VersionId=version_id)

                print(f'The versioned object with Bucket={s3_bucket_name_to_clean}, '
                      f'Key={key}, VersionId={version_id} was deleted')

                number_of_deleted_objects += 1

        delete_markers: list = page.get('DeleteMarkers')
        if delete_markers is not None:
            for delete_marker in delete_markers:
                key = delete_marker.get('Key')
                version_id = delete_marker.get('VersionId')
                s3_client.delete_object(Bucket=s3_bucket_name_to_clean, Key=key, VersionId=version_id)

                print(f'The delete marker with Bucket={s3_bucket_name_to_clean},'
                      f' Key={key}, VersionId={version_id} was deleted')

                number_of_deleted_objects += 1

    print(f'The number of deleted versioned objects and delete markers '
          f'in restore bucket is {number_of_deleted_objects}')

    return {'NumberOfDeletedObjects': number_of_deleted_objects}

mainSteps.name: AssertAlarmToBeRed
mainSteps.description: Wait for expected alarm to be red after failure is injected

mainSteps.name: RollbackCurrentExecution
mainSteps.description: Copy the files from the subfolder on the backup bucket to the subfolder on the source bucket.

inputs.Script:
from datetime import datetime, timezone
import math
import boto3
from botocore.config import Config
import time
import dateutil.parser




def copy_to_subfolder(events, context):
    if ('SourceBucket' not in events or 'TargetBucket' not in events
            or 'Subfolder' not in events):
        raise KeyError('Requires SourceBucket, TargetBucketName and Subfolder in events')

    source_bucket = events["SourceBucket"]
    target_bucket = events["TargetBucket"]
    subfolder = events["Subfolder"]

    if not subfolder.endswith('/'):
        subfolder = subfolder + '/'

    copied_count = copy_from_bucket_to_bucket(source_bucket, target_bucket, subfolder)

    return {'CopiedFilesNumber': copied_count}



def copy_from_bucket_to_bucket(source_bucket, target_bucket, prefix=None):
    config = Config(retries={'max_attempts': 20, 'mode': 'standard'})
    s3_client = boto3.client('s3', config=config)
    paginator = s3_client.get_paginator('list_objects_v2')
    if prefix:
        pages = paginator.paginate(Bucket=source_bucket, Prefix=prefix)
        print(f'Starting to copy files under prefix {prefix} from the {source_bucket} bucket '
              f'to the {target_bucket} bucket...')
    else:
        pages = paginator.paginate(Bucket=source_bucket)
        print(f'Starting to copy files from the {source_bucket} bucket '
              f'to the {target_bucket} bucket...')

    copied_count = 0
    for page in pages:
        print(f'The response from the list_objects_v2: {page}')
        if 'Contents' in page:
            for content in page["Contents"]:
                print(f'Copying the file {content["Key"]}...')

                copy_source = {
                    'Bucket': source_bucket,
                    'Key': content["Key"]
                }
                s3_client.copy(copy_source, target_bucket, content["Key"])

                print(f'The file {content["Key"]} was successfully copied')

                copied_count += 1

    print(f'The file number of copied files is {copied_count}')

    return copied_count

mainSteps.name: AssertAlarmToBeGreen
mainSteps.description: Wait for the alarm to be green after test is complete

mainSteps.name: DeleteSubfolderAfterTest
mainSteps.description: If the dedicated subfolder exists on the source bucket, clean it.

inputs.Script:
from datetime import datetime, timezone
import math
import boto3
from botocore.config import Config
import time
import dateutil.parser




def clean_subfolder_if_exists(events, context):
    if 'Bucket' not in events or 'Subfolder' not in events:
        raise KeyError('Requires Bucket, Subfolder in events')

    bucket = events["Bucket"]
    subfolder = events["Subfolder"]

    does_subfolder_exist_on_target = folder_exists_and_not_empty(bucket, subfolder)
    number_of_deleted_objects = 0

    if does_subfolder_exist_on_target:
        clean_bucket_output = clean_bucket({
            "S3BucketNameToClean": bucket,
            "Prefix": subfolder
        }, None)
        number_of_deleted_objects = clean_bucket_output['NumberOfDeletedObjects']

    return {'NumberOfDeletedObjects': number_of_deleted_objects}



def folder_exists_and_not_empty(bucket: str, path: str) -> bool:
    '''
    Folder should exists.
    Folder should not be empty.
    '''
    s3 = boto3.client('s3')
    if not path.endswith('/'):
        path = path + '/'
    resp = s3.list_objects_v2(Bucket=bucket, Prefix=path, Delimiter='/', MaxKeys=1)
    return 'Contents' in resp



def clean_bucket(events, context):
    """
    Clean bucket by removing versioned objects and delete markers
    :return: Number of removed versioned objects and delete markers
    """
    if 'S3BucketNameToClean' not in events:
        raise KeyError('Requires S3BucketNameToClean in events')

    s3_bucket_name_to_clean = events['S3BucketNameToClean']
    prefix = events.get('Prefix') or None

    config = Config(retries={'max_attempts': 20, 'mode': 'standard'})
    s3_client = boto3.client('s3', config=config)
    paginator = s3_client.get_paginator('list_object_versions')

    if prefix:
        pages = paginator.paginate(Bucket=s3_bucket_name_to_clean, Prefix=prefix)
        print(f'Sending the list_object_versions request for all objects under the {prefix} prefix,'
              f' of the {s3_bucket_name_to_clean} bucket...')
    else:
        pages = paginator.paginate(Bucket=s3_bucket_name_to_clean)
        print(f'Sending the list_object_versions request for all objects of the {s3_bucket_name_to_clean} bucket...')

    number_of_deleted_objects = 0

    for page in pages:
        print(f'The response from the list_object_versions: {page}')

        versions: list = page.get('Versions')
        if versions is not None:
            for version in versions:
                key = version.get('Key')
                version_id = version.get('VersionId')
                s3_client.delete_object(Bucket=s3_bucket_name_to_clean, Key=key, VersionId=version_id)

                print(f'The versioned object with Bucket={s3_bucket_name_to_clean}, '
                      f'Key={key}, VersionId={version_id} was deleted')

                number_of_deleted_objects += 1

        delete_markers: list = page.get('DeleteMarkers')
        if delete_markers is not None:
            for delete_marker in delete_markers:
                key = delete_marker.get('Key')
                version_id = delete_marker.get('VersionId')
                s3_client.delete_object(Bucket=s3_bucket_name_to_clean, Key=key, VersionId=version_id)

                print(f'The delete marker with Bucket={s3_bucket_name_to_clean},'
                      f' Key={key}, VersionId={version_id} was deleted')

                number_of_deleted_objects += 1

    print(f'The number of deleted versioned objects and delete markers '
          f'in restore bucket is {number_of_deleted_objects}')

    return {'NumberOfDeletedObjects': number_of_deleted_objects}
